com.sri.ai.grinder.sgdpllt.library

Class FormulaUtil

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.sri.ai.grinder.sgdpllt.library.FormulaUtil

  • @Beta
public class FormulaUtil
extends Object
    A collection of utility routines specific to formulas.
    Author:
    oreilly

      • isFormula

        public static boolean isFormula(Expression expression,
                                Context context)
        Determine if an expression is a formula.
        Parameters:
        expression - the expression to be tested if it is a formula.
        context - the context in which the expression is being used.
        Returns:
        true if the expression passed in is a formula, false otherwise.

        Returns:

      • getConstants

        public static Set<Expression> getConstants(Expression formula,
                                           Context context)
        Extract the constants from the given formula. This is done by checking the terms of any diseaulities or equalities in the formula as to whether or not they are constants. These are the only locations constants should exist in a formula.
        Parameters:
        formula - the formula constants are to be collected from.
        context - the current context, which is used to identify if a term is a constant.
        Returns:
        the set of constants present in the given formula (may be empty).

      • getPositiveLiterals

        public static Set<Expression> getPositiveLiterals(Expression formula,
                                                  Context context)
        Retrieve the postive literals in a formula.
        Parameters:
        formula - a formula.
        context - the context in which the expression is being used.
        Returns:
        the positive literals in the formula.

      • isClause

        public static boolean isClause(Expression expression,
                               Context context)
        Determine if the given expression is a Clause (i.e. a disjunction of literals only).
        Parameters:
        expression - the expression to be tested if a clause.
        context - the context in which the expression is being used.
        Returns:
        true if a clause, false otherwise.

      • isConjunctionOfLiterals

        public static boolean isConjunctionOfLiterals(Expression expression,
                                              Context context)
        Determine if the given expression is a conjunction of literals
        Parameters:
        expression - the expression to be tested if a clause.
        context - the context in which the expression is being used.
        Returns:
        true if a conjunction of literals, false otherwise.

      • isLiteral

        public static boolean isLiteral(Expression expression,
                                Context context)
        Determine if the given expression is a literal, i.e. an equality or disequality with 2 arguments, i.e. we exclude 'X = Y = Z' types of equality expressions and dont consider not(X = y) or not(X != Y) as literals in order to work with a simple form for literals.
        Parameters:
        expression - the expression to be tested whether or not is a 2 argument equality or inequality.
        context - the context in which the expression is being used.
        Returns:
        true if is a 2 argument equality or inequality.

      • isConditionalFormula

        public static boolean isConditionalFormula(Expression expressionF,
                                           Context context)
        Indicates whether an expression is a conditional formula, that is, an if-then-else expression with formulas in its then and else branches.
